intro: Swintonia minuta, commonly known as the small swintonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
